intro: Clinopodium laevigatum, commonly known as smooth betony, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers are small, clustered in whorls, and range in color from white to pale purple. Clinopodium laevigatum is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
